document_data.name: Ordulinian
document_data.mainbody:
'''Ordulinian''' was a [[cleric]] that lived in [[Baldur's Gate]] during the midâ€“14{{th}} century [[DR]].

{{Quote|The roads of this fair city are lined with fools, are they not?}}
document_data.Possessions: Ordulinian was the proud owner of a ''[[cloak of non-detection]]''.
document_data.Activities: Despite being a spellcaster of [[divine magic]], Ordulinian was a regular at the [[Sorcerous Sundries]] in the [[Baldur's Gate/Heapside|Heapside]] district of the city.
document_data.Relationships: He thought very little of [[Arkion]] and [[Nemphre]], two feuding [[necromancer]]s that lived in the city.
document_data.History: In the {{YearlinkName|1368}}, Ordulinian sought to stop Arkion and Nemphre in their petty contests that involved stealing trinkets from one another and bodies from [[Baldur's Gate/Sewers|the sewers]] that ran beneath the city. He hoped to do so without the use of violence if possible.
